title.narrative: SLCDF 2016-2018 Collective Engagement for Sustainable Growth of Vulnerable Community

description.narrative: The Collective engagement for equitable and sustainable growth of vulnerable communities. Work to bring women, men, community based organizations, local authorities and networks to collaborate for equitable inclusive development in the war affected district of North of Sri Lanka. The right holders are impacts of the war within these communities, there are most vulnerable groups such as women headed households, People with disabilities and combatants. This vulnerability is further compounded by a disempowered civil society and weak local governance resulting in prevailing social and economic injustices due to low productivity and limited resources. The objective is to strengthen CBOs and their representing communities, to help them play the role of the catalyst in enhancing the economic by facilitating sustainable livelihoods for community members; Inclusive communities and functional NGOs and CBOs collaborate to adhere to principles of good governance and actively engage with federations of agriculture, livestock and fisheries. Main activities; Social mobilization of community women and men to form and strengthen CSOs, facilitating link with service providers, Market mapping of primary products & skills, enhancing primary production in agriculture, fisheries and livestock sectors through the provision of high quality input, training, and linking with MFIs, Value addition, marketing and interfacing with government departments and private buyers and Building disaster resilience in primary production are the main activities of the project. The expected results: strengthened CBOs collaborate to adhere to the principles of good governance; the vulnerable community women and men are mobilized to increase household income and are more resilient to withstand shocks. The group of federation known as Yuga Shakthy will be empowered to raise issues and engage with local authorities and CSOs.
This project mainly contributes to results within Economic empowerment of women. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
